The `t` coefficient of an admissible linear change of variables.

type: {R : Type u} → [inst : CommRing R] → WeierstrassCurve.VariableChange R → R
name: WeierstrassCurve.VariableChange.t
docString: The `t` coefficient of an admissible linear change of variables.

For all real numbers `x` and `t`, and natural numbers `n`, the `n`th derivative of the function `x => (x - t) ^ (n + 1)` exists and is equal to `-(n + 1) * (x - t) ^ n`.

type: ∀ (t x : ℝ) (n : ℕ), HasDerivAt (fun y => (x - y) ^ (n + 1)) (-(↑n + 1) * (x - t) ^ n) t
name: monomial_has_deriv_aux
docString: For all real numbers `x` and `t`, and natural numbers `n`, the `n`th derivative of the function `x => (x - t) ^ (n + 1)` exists and is equal to `-(n + 1) * (x - t) ^ n`.

This theorem states that for any positive real number ε, any non-zero integer b, and any function A from the finite set of natural numbers less than n to the integers, there exists a function t such that for any two elements in the finite set, if they are mapped to the same value by function t, the absolute difference of their remainders when divided by b (when these elements are mapped by function A) is less than b times ε.

type:
∀ (n : ℕ) {ε : ℝ},
  0 < ε → ∀ {b : ℤ}, b ≠ 0 → ∀ (A : Fin n → ℤ), ∃ t, ∀ (i₀ i₁ : Fin n), t i₀ = t i₁ → ↑|A i₁ % b - A i₀ % b| < |b| • ε
name: AbsoluteValue.exists_partition_int
docString: This theorem states that for any positive real number ε, any non-zero integer b, and any function A from the finite set of natural numbers less than n to the integers, there exists a function t such that for any two elements in the finite set, if they are mapped to the same value by function t, the absolute difference of their remainders when divided by b (when these elements are mapped by function A) is less than b times ε.

The function `(1 + t/x) ^ x` tends to `exp t` at `+∞` for naturals `x`.

type: ∀ (t : ℝ), Filter.Tendsto (fun x => (1 + t / ↑x) ^ x) Filter.atTop (nhds (Real.exp t))
name: tendsto_one_plus_div_pow_exp
docString: The function `(1 + t/x) ^ x` tends to `exp t` at `+∞` for naturals `x`.

For all positive real numbers x <= 1 and t > 0, |log(x) * x^t| < 1/t.

name: Real.abs_log_mul_self_rpow_lt
docString: For all positive real numbers x <= 1 and t > 0, |log(x) * x^t| < 1/t.

This theorem states that for all real numbers `t` and `x`, and for all natural numbers `n`, the function `y => (x - y) ^ (n + 1)` has a derivative at the point `t`. The derivative at this point is given by `-(↑n + 1) * (x - t) ^ n`. This is a helper lemma used in the calculation of the derivative of the monomial that appears in Taylor expansions.

type: ∀ (t x : ℝ) (n : ℕ), HasDerivAt (fun y => (x - y) ^ (n + 1)) (-(↑n + 1) * (x - t) ^ n) t
name: monomial_has_deriv_aux
docString: This theorem states that for all real numbers `t` and `x`, and for all natural numbers `n`, the function `y => (x - y) ^ (n + 1)` has a derivative at the point `t`. The derivative at this point is given by `-(↑n + 1) * (x - t) ^ n`. This is a helper lemma used in the calculation of the derivative of the monomial that appears in Taylor expansions.

The function `(1 + t/x) ^ x` tends to `exp t` at `+∞`.

type: ∀ (t : ℝ), Filter.Tendsto (fun x => (1 + t / x) ^ x) Filter.atTop (nhds (Real.exp t))
name: tendsto_one_plus_div_rpow_exp
docString: The function `(1 + t/x) ^ x` tends to `exp t` at `+∞`.

The power function `x ↦ x^s` is integrable on `(0, t)` iff `-1 < s`.

type: ∀ {s t : ℝ}, 0 < t → (MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn (fun x => x ^ s) (Set.Ioo 0 t) ↔ -1 < s)
name: intervalIntegral.integrableOn_Ioo_rpow_iff
docString: The power function `x ↦ x^s` is integrable on `(0, t)` iff `-1 < s`.

the equivalence given by multiplication on the left by `t`

type:
{G : Type u_1} →
  [inst : Group G] →
    {A B : Subgroup G} →
      ↥A ≃* ↥B →
        {d : HNNExtension.NormalWord.TransversalPair G A B} → HNNExtension.NormalWord d ≃ HNNExtension.NormalWord d
name: HNNExtension.NormalWord.unitsSMulEquiv
docString: the equivalence given by multiplication on the left by `t`

Bound for `|log x * x ^ t|` in the interval `(0, 1]`, for positive real `t`.

type: ∀ (x t : ℝ), 0 < x → x ≤ 1 → 0 < t → |Real.log x * x ^ t| < 1 / t
name: Real.abs_log_mul_self_rpow_lt
docString: Bound for `|log x * x ^ t|` in the interval `(0, 1]`, for positive real `t`.

{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

The function `x * log (1 + t / x)` tends to `t` at `+∞`.

type: ∀ (t : ℝ), Filter.Tendsto (fun x => x * Real.log (1 + t / x)) Filter.atTop (nhds t)
name: Real.tendsto_mul_log_one_plus_div_atTop
docString: The function `x * log (1 + t / x)` tends to `t` at `+∞`.

If the left cosets of `t` by elements of `s` are disjoint (but not necessarily distinct!), then
the size of `t` divides the size of `s • t`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_2} {β : Type u_3} [inst : DecidableEq β] [inst_1 : Group α] [inst_2 : MulAction α β] {t : Finset β}
  {s : Finset α}, Set.PairwiseDisjoint ((fun x => x • t) '' ↑s) id → t.card ∣ (s • t).card
name: Finset.card_dvd_card_smul_right
docString:
If the left cosets of `t` by elements of `s` are disjoint (but not necessarily distinct!), then
the size of `t` divides the size of `s • t`.

If `t` is bounded, then so is `s ∩ t`

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Preorder α] {s t : Set α}, BddAbove t → BddAbove (s ∩ t)
name: BddAbove.inter_of_right
docString: If `t` is bounded, then so is `s ∩ t`

Markov's inequality for the counting measure with hypothesis using `tsum` in `ℝ≥0∞`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] [inst_1 : MeasurableSingletonClass α] {a : α → ENNReal},
  Measurable a →
    ∀ {c : ENNReal},
      ∑' (i : α), a i ≤ c → ∀ {ε : ENNReal}, ε ≠ 0 → ε ≠ ⊤ → ↑↑MeasureTheory.Measure.count {i | ε ≤ a i} ≤ c / ε
name: ENNReal.count_const_le_le_of_tsum_le
docString: Markov's inequality for the counting measure with hypothesis using `tsum` in `ℝ≥0∞`.

To prove that the lift of a supremum is bounded by some cardinal `t`,
it suffices to show that the lift of each cardinal is bounded by `t`.

type:
∀ {ι : Type v} {f : ι → Cardinal.{w}} {t : Cardinal.{max u w}},
  BddAbove (Set.range f) → (∀ (i : ι), Cardinal.lift.{u, w} (f i) ≤ t) → Cardinal.lift.{u, w} (iSup f) ≤ t
name: Cardinal.lift_iSup_le
docString:
To prove that the lift of a supremum is bounded by some cardinal `t`,
it suffices to show that the lift of each cardinal is bounded by `t`.

If the left cosets of `t` by elements of `s` are disjoint (but not necessarily distinct!), then
the size of `t` divides the size of `s * t`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_2} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : DecidableEq α] {s t : Finset α},
  Set.PairwiseDisjoint ((fun x => x • t) '' ↑s) id → t.card ∣ (s * t).card
name: Finset.card_dvd_card_mul_right
docString:
If the left cosets of `t` by elements of `s` are disjoint (but not necessarily distinct!), then
the size of `t` divides the size of `s * t`.

Markov's inequality for counting measure with hypothesis using `tsum` in `ℝ≥0`.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] [inst_1 : MeasurableSingletonClass α] {a : α → NNReal},
  Measurable a →
    Summable a →
      ∀ {c : NNReal},
        ∑' (i : α), a i ≤ c → ∀ {ε : NNReal}, ε ≠ 0 → ↑↑MeasureTheory.Measure.count {i | ε ≤ a i} ≤ ↑c / ↑ε
name: NNReal.count_const_le_le_of_tsum_le
docString: Markov's inequality for counting measure with hypothesis using `tsum` in `ℝ≥0`.

The theorem that $(e^X - 1) * ∑ Bₙ(t)* X^n/n! = Xe^{tX}$

type:
∀ {A : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing A] [inst_1 : Algebra ℚ A] (t : A),
  (PowerSeries.mk fun n => (Polynomial.aeval t) ((1 / ↑(Nat.factorial n)) • Polynomial.bernoulli n)) *
      (PowerSeries.exp A - 1) =
    PowerSeries.X * (PowerSeries.rescale t) (PowerSeries.exp A)
name: Polynomial.bernoulli_generating_function
docString: The theorem that $(e^X - 1) * ∑ Bₙ(t)* X^n/n! = Xe^{tX}$

type: ∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Preorder α] {s t : Set α}, BddBelow s → BddBelow (s ∩ t)
name: BddBelow.inter_of_left
docString: If `s` is bounded, then so is `s ∩ t`

The complex power function `x ↦ x^s` is integrable on `(0, t)` iff `-1 < s.re`.

type: ∀ {s : ℂ} {t : ℝ}, 0 < t → (MeasureTheory.IntegrableOn (fun x => ↑x ^ s) (Set.Ioo 0 t) ↔ -1 < s.re)
name: intervalIntegral.integrableOn_Ioo_cpow_iff
docString: The complex power function `x ↦ x^s` is integrable on `(0, t)` iff `-1 < s.re`.

The function `fun t ↦ inverse (x + t)` is O(1) as `t → 0`.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : NormedRing R] [inst_1 : CompleteSpace R] (x : Rˣ),
  (fun t => Ring.inverse (↑x + t)) =O[nhds 0] fun _t => 1
name: NormedRing.inverse_add_norm
docString: The function `fun t ↦ inverse (x + t)` is O(1) as `t → 0`.

The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : PseudoEMetricSpace α] {β : Type u_2} [inst_1 : One β] [inst_2 : TopologicalSpace β] (f : α → β)
  (E : Set α),
  Filter.Tendsto (fun δ => Set.mulIndicator (Metric.thickening δ E) f) (nhdsWithin 0 (Set.Ioi 0))
    (nhds (Set.mulIndicator (closure E) f))
name: tendsto_mulIndicator_thickening_mulIndicator_closure
docString:
The multiplicative indicators of δ-thickenings of a set tend pointwise to the multiplicative
indicator of the set, as δ>0 tends to zero.

Evaluation of a `Γ` term `t` for given solution `x`.

type:
{D : Type u_1} →
  {C : Type u_2} →

name: ValuedCSP.Term.evalSolution
docString: Evaluation of a `Γ` term `t` for given solution `x`.
